18:07 <cjd> mflorea: how do I change the height of the wysiwyg editor?  
18:08 <cjd> re http://realtime.webviewers.org/  
18:08 <cjd> you get a scroll bar  
18:08 <mflorea> the editor takes the height of the plain text area it replaces, so you can set the height on the plain text area  
18:10 <mflorea> but in your case it's not the editor height  
18:11 <mflorea> it's the height of the BODY element of the edited document (from the iframe)  
18:11 <cjd> <textarea id="realtime\_wysiwyg\_demo" class="hidden" cols="80" rows="25">Realtime Wysiwyg Editor</textarea>  
18:11 <mflorea> you don't have any styles applied on the edited document  
18:11 <cjd> I'm editing on a test wiki  
18:11 <mflorea> so the default browser styles are applied, which means the BODY element has the height of its content  
18:11 <cjd> if you install cjdns you can access it :)  
18:12 <mflorea> as you can see the height increases when you enter a new line  
18:12 <cjd> what I'm seeing is a style="height:100px" on the iframe  
18:12 <mflorea> take a look at the RichTextArea.css which is applied by the WYSIWYG editor to the edited document  
18:13 <mflorea> don't mix the outer document (iframe) with the inner document (the BODY elemet)  
18:13 <mflorea> hmm, wait a sec  
18:14 <cjd> I just dropped my <style> tag  
18:14 <cjd> and the class="hidden" from the textarea  
18:14 <mflorea> so yes, as I said, the editor takes the height of the text area  
18:15 <mflorea> just set the height on the plain text area  
18:15 <cjd> <iframe class="gwt-RichTextArea" style="height: 100px;"></iframe>  
18:15 <mflorea> 100px comes from the height of the plain text area  
18:15 <mflorea> offsetHeight  
18:15 <cjd> cols="80" rows="25"  
18:15 <mflorea> yes, offsetHeight is the computed height  
18:16 <cjd> aha, ok cols and rows doesn't work  
18:16 <cjd> it has to be specified in css  
18:16 <mflorea> cols and rows should works, but they are probably overwritten by CSS  
18:17 <mflorea> the editor basically tries to fix the area occupied by the plain text area  
18:17 <mflorea> s/fix/fit  
18:19 <cjd> ./do --post cjd:[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection):80/xwiki/rest/wikis/webviewers  
18:21 <cjd> this is odd  
18:25 <cjd> hmm pushing a xar to xwiki via rest doesn't always work
